Patch Set 5:

This patchset is huge, and is taking a function that's already bigger than it should be and doubling it in size.  Please clean this up, break it down into appropriate methods, and do your patches one at a time in a way they make sense.

Also, your commit message is entirely focused on a test case, which, while important for the tested statement, doesn't lay out what you actually did to change this handler, and reading the patchset, it's nearly impossible to determine based on the way you've structured it.

Looking forward to the cleanups.

Patch Set 5:

> Patch Set 5:
> 
> This patchset is huge, and is taking a function that's already bigger than it should be and doubling it in size.  Please clean this up, break it down into appropriate methods, and do your patches one at a time in a way they make sense.
> 
> Also, your commit message is entirely focused on a test case, which, while important for the tested statement, doesn't lay out what you actually did to change this handler, and reading the patchset, it's nearly impossible to determine based on the way you've structured it.
> 
> Looking forward to the cleanups.

Hi Ed,
Thanks your help to review this commit and give me some suggestions.
Yes, the Patch Set 5 is huge that not only include my original method.

The Patch Set 4 is my original method for this issue,
but I got CI Build Failed as below:
https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/31274/ : FAILURE

Thus, I modify Patch Set 4 to Set 5 for making CI Build Successful
https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/31291/ : SUCCESS

Could you kindly help me to check the Patch Set 4 whether is enough?
The CI Build Failed problem whether is can be ignored? Thanks.

BTW, I check the Build Failed log as below then modify it for Build Successful.
https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/31274/console

Sincerely,
Tim

Patch Set 5:

Thanks your great help to watch and give me some suggestions.

Best regards,
Tim

No response from submitter.

Can you please use a real variable name here?
Single letter variable names are bad for readablity, searchablity, etc. 
In places where it is clear (e.g. iterating over a collection) I don't mind it but I don't it is appropriate here.
Done
Done

Need a mapper call here? 
I don't think "xyz.openbmc_project.NodeManagerProxy" is a service everyone uses.
Done

Hello Ed,

Sorry to interrupt you about this commit again.
Did you check the latest patch I made?
If there is any suggestions, please don't hesitate to tell me. Thanks.

Sincerely,
Tim

Hello Ed,
Could you help us to review the latest patch according your suggestion again?
Thanks in advance.

Best regards,
Tim
friendly ping
These multi-tiered lambdas still need broken up into appropriate methods.  At this function we are 4 lambda scopes deep, and this patchset makes it a 300+ line single method.

Change to use getPowerMetricData function to reduce the lambda scope deep.
Please help to review it again. Thank you.
Redfish Validator passes?

No. we just run single test for power control metrics is PASS.
Should we run Redfish Validator?

According to JsonSchemas/Power/Power.json, we add below properties for passing automation test about chassis power control.

"AverageConsumedWatts"
"IntervalInMin"
"MaxConsumedWatts"
"MinConsumedWatts"

Hi Gunnar,
We just run single test for power control metrics and result is PASS.
Should we run Redfish Validator? Thanks your review.

Best regards,
Tim

Dear Gunnar,

We have run Redfish Service Validator for GET behavior of PowerMetrcis and test result is PASS as below.

Could you help to review and merge it if there is no any concern? Thank you.

Dear All,

There are many build error messages seems not relate to sensors.hpp modification.

199018 warnings and 2 errors generated.
Error while processing /data0/jenkins/workspace/ci-repository/openbmc/bmcweb/src/security_headers_middleware_test.cpp.
/data0/jenkins/workspace/ci-repository/openbmc/bmcweb/src/security_headers_middleware_test.cpp:3:10: error: 'security_headers_middleware.hpp' file not found [clang-diagnostic-error]

Could someone help to re-trigger CI to clarify this build error whether is relate to CI or the other environment issue? Thanks.

Best regards,
Tim
Are you rebase to the latest master?
Thanks your help, I just rebase it. Thanks.
It is not recommended to declare it as a global
Thanks. I will move into getPowerMetricData() in next patchset.
Please refer: https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/60384/10/COMMON_ERRORS.md#356
yes
Thanks. Please help us to review the change in Patchset 27.
Nit: auto
Thanks. I will change to const auto& in next patchset.
Can you separate out this logic?
Do you means that from line 3003 to 3068 need to separate to another function then called by getPowerMetricData() function inside?
Can you please write this in normal sentences.  Feel free to talk about the test in your tested section, but please document the feature you added.  As written, this is a feature, not a bug.

Thanks for your patch!  Lets get the cleanups done, get the interfaces documented in phosphor-dbus-interfaces, get the Redfish documentation updated with your new properties, and this should be good to go.
still not updated here.
Please use the existing variant types.  SEnsors does not need its own variant type.
for objects only used in one place, please prefer to put them in the same scope as the implementation that uses them.
still not updated here.
Please use the helper functions for doing this kind of property reading.

Please don't pass by SensorsAsyncResponse.  It is a data structure that does too much already, and is overused.  Looking at your code, it looks like you only need to pass sensorsAsyncResp.asyncResp (ie, the bmcweb::AsyncResp object).

Where is this namespace documented?

Also, as written, this is going to return the same power entries for all chassis, which is a bug.  You need to sort them into the chassis that the power metrics are assigned to, generally done by looking up an association, and matching up the ChassisId.
This Log is redundant
